description: From Latin vacātus, perfect participle of vacō.

verbs.description: vacate (third-person singular simple present vacates, present participle vacating, simple past and past participle vacated)

entries.meaning: To move out of a dwelling, either by choice or by eviction.
examples: I have to vacate my house by midday, as the new owner is moving in.
You are hereby ordered to vacate the premises within 14 days.

entries.meaning: To leave an office or position.
examples: He vacated his coaching position because of the corruption scandal.

entries.meaning: (law) To have a court judgement set aside; to annul.
examples: The judge vacated the earlier decision when new evidence was presented.

entries.meaning: To leave an area, usually as a result of orders from public authorities in the event of a riot or natural disaster.
examples: If you do not immediately vacate the area, we will make you leave with tear gas!
